intro: Musineon divaricatum var. divaricatum, commonly known as the variable musineon, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
